title: Special Variables in Shell Scripting
description: In this lab, you will explore special variables in shell scripting. You'll learn to use variables like $0, $1, $#, $?, and $$ to access script name, command-line arguments, argument count, exit status, and process ID. You'll also understand the difference between $@ and $* for handling multiple arguments.

meta.title: Shell Scripting: Mastering Special Variables and Execution Environment
meta.description: Learn to utilize special variables in shell scripts to access command-line arguments, script information, and process details. Enhance your scripts with powerful built-in variables.
meta.keywords: shell scripting, special variables, command-line arguments, script name, process ID, exit status, $@, $*, bash scripting
